WorldObjectDef.description: An ice asteroid that was captured and maneuvered into orbit around the planet during an early colonization effort. Its surface is entirely covered in frozen layers, giving it a reflective, pale appearance unlike most other asteroids.\n\nThis location can be reached using transport pods, shuttles, or a gravship.
WorldObjectDef.label: ice asteroid

WorldObjectDef.description: A vacstone asteroid cluster orbiting the planet, consisting of several fragments drifting in close formation. It may have once been a larger body that broke apart, or a group of smaller asteroids captured together by gravity.\n\nThis location can be reached using transport pods, shuttles, or a gravship.
WorldObjectDef.label: asteroid cluster

WorldObjectDef.description: A dense cluster of countless small vacstone asteroids and rock fragments, slowly drifting together in a loose orbit. While too small to host major mining operations, the field poses a notable navigational challenge.\n\nThis location can be reached using transport pods, shuttles, or a gravship.
WorldObjectDef.label: asteroid field

WorldObjectDef.description: A vacstone asteroid riddled with countless cavities and hollow chambers, formed by ages of impacts and erosion. Its honeycombed structure makes it fragile and unstable, with many of its tunnels collapsing into each other over time.\n\nThis location can be reached using transport pods, shuttles, or a gravship.
WorldObjectDef.label: porous asteroid

WorldObjectDef.description: A massive vacstone asteroid, far larger than the typical fragments found in orbit. Its sheer bulk makes it a landmark in space, dominating its surroundings with its presence.\n\nThis location can be reached using transport pods, shuttles, or a gravship.
WorldObjectDef.label: giant asteroid

WorldObjectDef.description: A vacstone asteroid broken apart by a massive impact. Its pieces remain loosely bound, forming a jagged and uneven shape with wide gaps between its fragments.\n\nThis location can be reached using transport pods, shuttles, or a gravship.
WorldObjectDef.label: giant asteroid

WorldObjectDef.description: A vacstone asteroid so tightly packed and solid that it leaves little usable surface. Its sheer density makes it difficult to find safe or practical landing zones.\n\nThis location can be reached using transport pods, shuttles, or a gravship.
WorldObjectDef.label: dense asteroid

WorldObjectDef.description: A very small vacstone asteroid drifting through orbit. Asteroids of this size are often unstable and eventually fall as meteors, striking surfaces below.\n\nThis location can be reached using transport pods, shuttles, or a gravship.
WorldObjectDef.label: small asteroid

WorldObjectDef.description: A vacstone asteroid with the shattered remains of an old orbital station clinging to its surface. Twisted beams, broken modules, and drifting debris hint at a structure long abandoned. Most of the station has collapsed into the asteroid itself, leaving only fragments scattered across its exterior.\n\nThis location can be reached using transport pods, shuttles, or a gravship.
WorldObjectDef.label: asteroid with ruins
derelict station
WorldObjectDef.description: A derelict orbital station, long since abandoned and stripped of anything valuable. Only its skeletal frame drifts silently through space, a reminder of what once was.n\nThis location can be reached using transport pods, shuttles, or a gravship.

WorldObjectDef.label: solid core asteroid
WorldObjectDef.description:
A vacstone asteroid with an unusually solid core of valuable minerals. Normally found far from planetary orbit, this one has shifted into a lower trajectory, making it a rare mining opportunity.

The vacstone is densely packed, and mining will take longer than normal. You detect no signs of life.

This location can be reached using transport pods, shuttles, or a gravship.

WorldObjectDef.label: gravship generation site
WorldObjectDef.description: A temporary site used for generating gravship textures.
